#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=SUSAN HENCHARD
#Text=Her husband regarded the paper as if it were a window-pane through which he saw for miles .
#Text=His lips twitched , and he seemed to compress his frame , as if to bear better .
#Text=His usual habit was not to consider whether destiny were hard upon him or not — the shape of his ideals in cases of affliction being simply a moody “ I am to suffer , I perceive . ”
#Text=“ This much scourging , then , it is for me . ”
#Text=But now through his passionate head there stormed this thought — that the blasting disclosure was what he had deserved .
#Text=His wife ’s extreme reluctance to have the girl ’s name altered from Newson to Henchard was now accounted for fully .
#Text=It furnished another illustration of that honesty in dishonesty which had characterized her in other things .
#Text=He remained unnerved and purposeless for near a couple of hours ; till he suddenly said , “ Ah — I wonder if it is true ! ”
#Text=He jumped up in an impulse , kicked off his slippers , and went with a candle to the door of Elizabeth-Jane ’s room , where he put his ear to the keyhole and listened .
#Text=She was breathing profoundly .
#Text=Henchard softly turned the handle , entered , and shading the light , approached the bedside .
#Text=Gradually bringing the light from behind a screening curtain he held it in such a manner that it fell slantwise on her face without shining on her eyes .
#Text=He steadfastly regarded her features .
#Text=They were fair : his were dark .
#Text=But this was an unimportant preliminary .
#Text=In sleep there come to the surface buried genealogical facts , ancestral curves , dead men ’s traits , which the mobility of daytime animation screens and overwhelms .
#Text=In the present statuesque repose of the young girl ’s countenance Richard Newson ’s was unmistakably reflected .
#Text=He could not endure the sight of her , and hastened away .
#Text=Misery taught him nothing more than defiant endurance of it .
#Text=His wife was dead , and the first impulse for revenge died with the thought that she was beyond him .
#Text=He looked out at the night as at a fiend .

#Text=Henchard , like all his kind , was superstitious , and he could not help thinking that the concatenation of events this evening had produced was the scheme of some sinister intelligence bent on punishing him .
#Text=Yet they had developed naturally .
#Text=If he had not revealed his past history to Elizabeth he would not have searched the drawer for papers , and so on .
#Text=The mockery was , that he should have no sooner taught a girl to claim the shelter of his paternity than he discovered her to have no kinship with him .
#Text=This ironical sequence of things angered him like an impish trick from a fellow-creature .
#Text=Like Prester John ’s , his table had been spread , and infernal harpies had snatched up the food .
#Text=He went out of the house , and moved sullenly onward down the pavement till he came to the bridge at the bottom of the High Street .
#Text=Here he turned in upon a bypath on the river bank , skirting the north-eastern limits of the town .
#Text=These precincts embodied the mournful phases of Casterbridge life , as the south avenues embodied its cheerful moods .

#Text=The whole way along here was sunless , even in summer time ; in spring , white frosts lingered here when other places were steaming with warmth ; while in winter it was the seed-field of all the aches , rheumatisms , and torturing cramps of the year .
#Text=The Casterbridge doctors must have pined away for want of sufficient nourishment but for the configuration of the landscape on the north-eastern side .

#Text=The river — slow , noiseless , and dark — the Schwarzwasser of Casterbridge — ran beneath a low cliff , the two together forming a defence which had rendered walls and artificial earthworks on this side unnecessary .
#Text=Here were ruins of a Franciscan priory , and a mill attached to the same , the water of which roared down a back-hatch like the voice of desolation .
#Text=Above the cliff , and behind the river , rose a pile of buildings , and in the front of the pile a square mass cut into the sky .
#Text=It was like a pedestal lacking its statue .

#Text=This missing feature , without which the design remained incomplete , was , in truth , the corpse of a man , for the square mass formed the base of the gallows , the extensive buildings at the back being the county gaol .
#Text=In the meadow where Henchard now walked the mob were wont to gather whenever an execution took place , and there to the tune of the roaring weir they stood and watched the spectacle .
#Text=The exaggeration which darkness imparted to the glooms of this region impressed Henchard more than he had expected .
#Text=The lugubrious harmony of the spot with his domestic situation was too perfect for him , impatient of effects scenes , and adumbrations .
#Text=It reduced his heartburning to melancholy , and he exclaimed , “ Why the deuce did I come here ! ”

#Text=He went on past the cottage in which the old local hangman had lived and died , in times before that calling was monopolized over all England by a single gentleman ; and climbed up by a steep back lane into the town .
#Text=For the sufferings of that night , engendered by his bitter disappointment , he might well have been pitied .
#Text=He was like one who had half fainted , and could neither recover nor complete the swoon .

#Text=In words he could blame his wife , but not in his heart ; and had he obeyed the wise directions outside her letter this pain would have been spared him for long — possibly for ever , Elizabeth-Jane seeming to show no ambition to quit her safe and secluded maiden courses for the speculative path of matrimony .
